Direct Known Subclasses:
CounterTransactionImpl, TerminationTransactionImpl
public class TransactionImpl
extends AsyncJdbcOperation
implements Transaction

Implement a SQL transaction. This class was written while looking at Ant's SQLExec, though there wasnt any direct cut and paste. Its a lot simpler, as it offers less options for SQL processing, and corrects some ambiguities in Ant's task created 20-Sep-2006 17:25:59

sfStart

public void sfStart()
             throws org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException,
                    java.rmi.RemoteException
The startup operation is to read the commands in then execute them by way of executeStartupCommands(). Subclasses may change this behaviour

Specified by:

checkAndRunTerminationCommands

protected void checkAndRunTerminationCommands()
Check for and run the termination commands. Any exceptions raised by runTerminationCommands() are logged at the warn level but otherwise ignored

runTerminationCommands

protected void runTerminationCommands()
                               throws org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException,
                                      java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                      java.sql.SQLException
Override point: termination commands. All exceptions should be caught and printed here. The default implementation does nothing.

Throws:
org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException - SmartFrog problems
java.rmi.RemoteException - network problems
java.sql.SQLException - SQL problems

crackCommands

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> crackCommands(java.lang.String sql,
                                                      java.lang.String commandDelimiter)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
Crack the command string into a list of commands (which may be zero), at every line-ending delimiter. delimiters not at tne d

Parameters:
sql - SQL command
commandDelimiter - the delimiter for commands.
Returns:
a (possibly empty) list of commands.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the string cannot be read reliably

executeCommands

public void executeCommands(java.sql.Connection connection,
                            java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> commandIterator)
                     throws org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogDeploymentException
Execute a sequence of commands. It takes an iterator so anything can act as a source of commands; there isnt even any need for the type to be string, as long as the toString() method of each iterated value returns a single SQL command (without delimeter)

Parameters:
connection - connection to use
commandIterator - iterator over the commands to run
Throws:
org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogDeploymentException
